title: Balloon Festival Crit
course: 1 mile , technical 6 turn loop in an urban area.
registration: Registration opens at 8:30am. Pre registration is recommended. Online registration is available on Bikereg at www.bikereg.com. Bikereg applies a standard service fee to entries. There will be a $10 late fee charged to "day of" entries. There will be NO REFUNDS. One day licenses are available for $15.00 on the day of the race. USAC License is required in all but Kid's races. BY mail please send completed 2014 USAC entry/ Release form to Rainbow Bike, 97 Lisbon st., Lewiston, ME 04240
notes: USAC rules will apply, Helmets required, no tank tops allowed
directions: From North or South take Lewiston Exit 80 off Interstate RT 95. Take left onto Alfred Plourde Parkway, go .2 miles and look for RT 196/ Lisbon st. Lewiston (2nd right ramp). Follow to 97 Lisbon St (Rainbow Bike registration area)

title: Downeast Cyclocross
description: Cyclocross racing at Pineland Farms, New Gloucester, Maine during peak foliage season. Spectacular scenery, great venue, challenging course. Kids races and even single speed categories
course: This years course returns to the upper part of the Pinelands Farm campus. Mix of open field and woods trails that Pineland is famous for.
registration:
Registration: Entry fee for all races is $30. Entries must be received by Tuesday Oct. 14th, 2014 at 5:00 PM ET, or add $5.00 late fee. Entry fee includes all applicable USA Cycling Insurance surcharge. No refunds on day of event. One Day licenses will be available for purchase. Day-of registration opens at 8:30am. Riders must  register at least 30 minutes prior to the start of their event.

Note: Riders can race in additional races for $15. Start positions determined by rider rankings at crossresults.com.

On-line registration only at www.bikereg.com.On-line service fee applied based on bikereg.com standard service rates
notes:
Check out the event venue at www.pinelandfarms.org there is plenty there to keep the whole family interested for the weekend.

ALSO- Dogs are not allowed at Pineland farms, you won't be allowed to bring your dog out of the car even if on a leash, sorry!
directions: Directions- Take the Maine Turnpike to Exit 63 in Gray, Maine. Bear to the right after the toll booth toward the center of Gray Village. Stay in the right lane. At the first intersection, go straight through the light onto rt 115 and continue on rt 115(east)  then turn left onto Mill St.. Continue on Mill till you reach Rt 231/ Intervale Rd. Turn left onto rt 231/ Intervale road then left onto Morse rd. and enter the Campus on your right.

title: Casco Bay Cyclocross
description: Working closely with lead sponsor Bikeman.com, Strategic Racing and Training presents an annual grass roots cyclocross race on the beautiful Eastern Promenade in Portland, Maine. The course and spectator viewing areas feature stunning views of Casco Bay. The venue offers plenty of parking, a playground for the kids, access to walking paths and picnic areas. Local food trucks will cater to racers and spectators throughout the day. Event proceeds are annually donated to the Eastern Promenade associate non-profit: Friends of the Eastern Promenade.
course: The Casco Bay Cyclocross course will take place on the Eastern Promenade overlooking Casco Bay. The course weaves throughout the Eastern Prom trails utilizing man made and natural obstacles, steep climbs, and unique downhills. It includes a mix of grassy fields, single and double track, and a paved road section where the course begins and ends. There will be two sets of barriers, one short, steep climb, and one pit. The course is skillfully designed and set up by Bikeman.com.
directions:
By Car
From Boston: 95 North to I-295 North, exit 7 (Franklin Arterial) Take right off exit to go Franklin St. Turn left on Fox St. Turn left onto Washington Ave. Take the first right on Walnut St. The race is at the bottom of Walnut St. on the Eastern Promenade.

From Points North: Take 95 South to I-295 South – follow the above in town directions.

From Points West: Take Route 302 East to I-295 – follow the above in town directions.

By Bike
The Eastern Promenade is located at the intersection of Congress Street and Eastern Promenade. Follow the road or or the Eastern Promenade Trail to the venue on top of the hill.

By Train
The Amtrak Downeaster runs from Boston to Portland.
